title: insensitive paediatrician
body: the paediatrician i saw here with my 2 year old for possible asd gdd etc was a very insensitive doctor she had no idea about sensory issues and the problems with these disorders told me to give my child chicken and she will eat it ! also told me that her eyes and nose are strange but did not explain why even though my girl has perfectly normal features left me and my husband very sad this doctor did not understand that you cant force a child with asd to eat chicken or whatever as textures smells etc can actually cause a physical pain to them very rude and uneducated person around these specific disorders after waiting and chasing up constantly this appointment was a great disappointment i feel that the doctor was a good doctor just not a doctor that had knowledge around children with these difficulties and if that's the case they really shouldn't be involved in a department that is supposed to be specialised in these factors.

title: Drs don’t listen
body: Doctor rang me while I was at work despite my asking receptionist for them to ring later. The doctor did not seem to have read my notes at all and was surprised when I told her that I need a hip replacement and needed painkillers till I could see the surgeon in October. She then reeled off all the down sides of taking painkillers long term, I am in constant pain but I feel that because I’ve had other health problems previously that they are not taking me seriously

title: Dismissive doctors
body: After finally getting an in person appointment I was met with a doctor who didn't listen to me and kept talking over me. He dismissed me with no medication or idea what was wrong with me. Went straight to the pharmacists told them my symptoms and they correctly diagnosed me and gave me some medication!

title: Rude staff
body:
So went in with my daughter   Wasnt sure about which desk n the receptionist rolled her eyes at us like we were taking up too much time    Extremely rude   I work at a hospital n know thats not good practice    Needs retraining and a bit of kindness wouldnt go amiss 
Felt like we were in the way and shouldnt be ill   Not good and will not be coming here again

title: Best Doctors in my area
body:
Yes i could complain that waiting on the phone to be answered is frustration, but i'm sure this is no different than any other Doctors
But i have filled in the E consultation and cannot complain ref the response, recently i had Covid and was coughing so much it affected my breathing, one of the Doctors asked me to meet him in the car park to test my oxygen levels before prescribing antibiotics. he also had the prescription sent to the Chemist within 20 mins 
he could have just sent a prescription.
I have also found all staff including reception and Nurses to be extremely helpful and polite 
i am more than happy to recommend Marsh Street Doctors

title: Terrible service
body:
After not having slept at all for a week, they kept making out that it was not a big thing. My gp didn't want to do anything to help me at all.
Then the practice manager, or something, refused to listen to what I was saying. She just kept treating me like a child and kept interrupting me. She also gave me way too much information about hers and the gps personal lives, which I found completely unprofessional anyway, but then to actually use them as excuses was completely unacceptable.

title: Excellent practice
body:
Both doctors and reception team have been amazing over the past 4 weeks. I attended the practice with a pain in my back, a month ago, only to end up being referred to hospital with a range of exploratory investigations to be carried out.
I'm terrible when it comes to organising my life but the reception staff contacted me daily/weekly to make sure I'd arranged appointments that I would otherwise not have engaged with.
A massive thankyou to all the doctors and staff who really make this a most efficient and professional practice.
In the most difficult of times the NHS soldiers on and for one I am thankful and grateful for their support and reassurance.

title: nurses are excellent
body:
i was seen by a practice nurse, instead of a doctor, she was excellent.approachable and sorted out my problem.
i would rather see a nurse if possible, i feel as if i am able to have more time with them.  all of the nurses i  have seen in this practice are excellent.

title: Bad news xperience
body: After waiting for about 45 minutes after my appointment and seeing people passing by after arriving after me, I turned to the secretary and told her how it was possible that people were arriving and I have not yet been called, with a lot of kindness and a little bit of frustration. Finally they called me, the doctor asked me some questions to understand, some nonsense. I found a lack of professionalism, then the the manager of the clinic came in front of me saying that the girl at the reception has felt offended and that I had to apologize for how I addressed her.what? So she came and I have to say sorry to her for no reason!I have no words to describe the bad experience I had and how I felt. I certainly won't go back.

readBy.name: Chelsea and Westminster Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Worst experience of my life
body:
So much disappointed with the service, I went to the hospital at 8:30 pm with severe back and right rib cage pain I was seen by the nurse after 2 hours and the Dr saw me after 9 hours and he was so rude that he saw me crying in pain and told me to hurry up because he has more patients to see. He didn't show any sympathy or even apologised for being late. The night shift nurses didn't even give a dam I requested paracetamol 3 times but was ignored.
Finally when I saw the Dr he told me to get a scan which he said will be at 8am so just wait outside the surgical clinic when I went there they told me I was booked for 10:30am. That's how incompetent these doctors so even after 12 hours of pain they still wanted me to wait just because the Dr made a mistake. 

Disgusted by the croydon University hospital, if we have to wait on those stupid chairs for 8 to 10 hours to see a Dr why not make us an appointment and tell people to go home and comeback after 8 hours.

Shame on all involved as I have seen people fainting, bleeding,  cryng in pain but they never cared or showed any sympathy they treated people worst then animals.

title: Appalling service
body: I have just suffered a dreadful telephone consultation we’re I was able to hear the doctor swear three times as I asked him questions about my health this is appalling given these people are funded by tax payers to provide a professional service. They have completely forgotten that they are dealing with people who have concerns. They avoid as much as possible face to face contact and have been extremely discourteous to me.

title: Rude Receptionist
body: This is my second review this week about the same person. Her behaviour and attitude reflects badly on this GP Surgery. She has somehow taken an instant dislike of me. I went in this morning (17th) and when she saw me she immediately turned her head away, said "oh no," and whispered something to her colleague. I went to the window and after about 5 minutes of her ignoring me and staring into space, she reluctantly asked if she could help. My previous encounters with her had made me wary, so I told her, I would wait for the other Receptionist, who was on a phone call. She tried not to voice her displeasure or say anything inappropriate, but her body language, gestures and eye rolling let her down. I did not face her directly, but viewed her actions peripherally.  I dread going into the Surgery, in case she is on duty. Last week, I was actually standing by the window waiting and she called the man in the back of me. I objected and she sighed loudly and dealt with me first. She works in an environment where you have to be compassionate, empathic and sensitive when dealing with the public. I think she lacks people skills, which is blatantly evident. She needs more training in Customer care. I have not made a formal complaint or spoken to anyone at the Surgery about this issue.

title: Anonymus
body: I requested an emergency prescription. However, the doctor released an empty one. When at the pharmacy, they called the receptionist at the Simpson Centre. The receptionist refused to send another copy of the prescription, arguing that they didn't send an online prescription. After a discussion, the receptionist argued that the pharmacist's tone was inappropriate and that she was going to hand down the phone.

title: Brilliant staff and role model
body: All the staff I was in contact with for my recent emergency were absolutly fantastic, from call center,ambulance.resus to ward 3 and to ward 24 where all the staff were fantastic all are stars and one a mega star and role model to women (I still stick my hand up for stats at night),could not fault my treatment at all, people need to spend just one shift with these people to see what a brilliant job they do, a very big thankyou to all of you, you are all stars to me

readBy.name: Healthwatch Doncaster
Doncaster and Bassetlaw Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Rude Receptionist
body: Every time I have to speak to this particular receptionist that I had to speak to again today, she is obstructive, unhelpful, uninterested, obnoxious, rude and gives me attitude. She never listens and I repeatedly have to explain my problem. She cut me off today, which is particularly unhelpful, as I am a vulnerable adult. I am disgusted by her telephone manner.

title: Think about dignity when dealing with the elderly…
body:
Mum is 81 she has other health issues besides what she was admitted for (TKR) especially around the toileting area.  When asking a nurse on day shift "when passing could you please provide me with a commode" the nurse in questions shouted "I'll get to you when I can" mum then said "I'm not expecting you to drop what you're doing but I will need it shortly as I may wet myself"  the nurse then replied "you wouldn't do it at home". Where upon my mother replied "I have been known to do so actually because of my mobility problems and only having one functioning kidney"

The night staff were excellent and one male nurse in particular kept us informed every step of the way.

On another note during surgery the surgeon accidentally cut my mother on her shin - this was reported and entered in the report log.

readBy.name: Mid Cheshire Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: It can't be worse
body: Hello, I probably haven't found any feedback in my life. However, this is the first time I encounter such NHS workers as Upper Tooting Road Medical Centre. When it comes to my health, I cannot remain silent. I called on Monday and asked for a visit, she asked me when I want and if the same day is suitable, I said that Tuesday is the best for me, she said that's great, I just need to call on Tuesday and they will give me an hour, I did so, but today I was told that the place is no longer available . (The conversation took place at 8:04 a.m.). When I said that I needed it as soon as possible because I no longer have the medicine that I take constantly, they found a place for me only on October 3rd.when I said that I was told to call the same day, she told me that there are no more places, I asked how come there are no more places in 4 minutes, she just tells me "sorry". This means I have to go private GP. I just don't understand why we pay for mandatory health insurance if services are not provided to me when they are vitally important to me? I wasn't even asked how long I've had the medicine for, or if it's been a long time since I've had it. Zero politeness, and I'm really considering moving my whole family to another one GP.  I just realized that the health of a person in GP means nothing. it's a pity that I had to choose this GP (to be more precise, I've never been to this GP, ) I wasn't even offered a doctor's consultation after re-appointment, even though they knew that I was constantly taking medication. It's a pity, but I will have to choose another GP, for whom the person's health is important...

title: Wait time on a&e
body:
14 hours nearly in a&e, 
That’s beyond a joke in anyones records, 
If I had of known I would of gone to another hospital , 
I wouldn’t mind but it’s not even busy!

readBy.name: Manchester University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Restricting Acess to Appointments
body:
Since removing ask my GP there is a link to click on the website if you don't want to wait hours on the phone to book an appointment 


It's a shame this link always say they are 'Out of Hours' so you can't actually book an appointment without ringing


For the last 40 mins there has been 'over 10 people in the queue' yet I can't book an appointment any other way...

title: Great Service
body:
I have recently visited this surgery several times in the past few months. The waiting room has always been full and the receptionists are very helpful and polite, considering the amount of pressure they are under they are doing a great job. 
I found in the last year that the service has improved drastically post covid and feel that the reviews I have read on google are not a true reflection on the surgery.  I have had 5 face to face appointments and all GP's I have seen have been professional and have met my requirements. 
After a recent coffee morning which I attended, in which the practice manger was present, I can honestly say everybody I spoke to that was present feels that she is a good asset to the surgery.
 Keep up the good work!!

title: Frailty assessment unit- Great practice, care and…
body: This review is based on the frailty assessment unit which is where my mum was seen today, unfortunately there is no section for the frailty team, can this department be added to the 'review of services section' so that the fabulous care, friendliness, and attention to detail can be recognised. All staff were so kind to my mum and tried to put her at ease. She had a full MDT assessment and the team all worked so well together. It was all summarised then by the consultant, ACP and therapy and my mum went away with a really clear healthcare plan. Please can this review be passed on to the frailty team to acknowledge the extremely high level of care that was delivered. Its such a fabulous service with the aim of keeping people out of hospital.

readBy.name: North Cheshire Hospitals NHS Trust

title: No complaints from me!
body: I have never had any problems with this surgery and in fact listening to my friends and family when they are 78th in the queue at 8 am I'm usually 4/5.  The receptionists are very helpful and have gone out of their way to help me get a repeat prescription when I have forgot to order, even when I was away on holiday! Today I did and e-consult and was called in 3 hours, great service! Can not fault, not sure what the other reviews are about to be honest......

title: Quick service
body: I had a head scan, blood test and ecg. Was only there 2 and 3/4 hours, staff were very pleasant and friendly, i was very impressed with the service,  well done lister ......

title: Signage
body: Took relative to Rawcliffe ward for day surgery.  The lack of signage was very concerning. Access to the ward was via the entrance to Duxbury and Worden wards. There were no signs visible from the perimeter Road. Luckily I had a site map and was mobile enough to get out the car and walk round in the vicinity as the signs were hidden behind a wooden structure. I have no complaints about my relatives care buy had he and his partner been on their own they didn't have the mobility to have found the ward.

readBy.name: Lancashire Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Amazing people, thank you
body: We are so lucky to have you all. I was in day surgery yesterday and do this every six months. Never gets any easier but my goodness it is made less stressful by everyone from reception right to the theatre team. Then recovery and Ward 12 afterwards still so wonderful. I cannot thank you all enough. I just hope this puts new patients going to surgery a little easier, especially for the first time. Bless you.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Dorset NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent care home
body:
My wife was admitted to Dovedale Court home from hospital but unfortunately passed away six days after moving there.
The loving care she received was outstanding from all the caring staff.
Nothing was too much trouble to keep her comfortable and the way they looked after the family was really appreciated.

title: Very poor practice
body:
Never can i get an appointment, have to do an E-Consult everytime with the same problem which they did not help me with. 08:00 in the morning, number one in the queue and i have to wait 20 minutes. They do not have the Blood test forms ready even they send a message to book an appointment . I have to call the 3rd time for that. 
I am not happy at all it is my health and i want to do the test asap but they do not care just wait

title: Love The Poplars
body: Every time I have to ring the doctor I get anxious, remembering what an ordeal it used to be at my previous surgery. It's a completely different experience here. The receptionists are fabulous, speak to you like you're a human being, and put themselves out to help. The doctors I've spoken to are absolutely amazing. They're really lovely and seem to actually care about their patients. It's a long time since I've had anything good to say about my old surgery. I'd never go back now. I love the Poplars!

title: Helpful and considerate team
body: Just want to give you a big thank you for your care and expertise, and for giving me the time to sort things out.  Thank you again.

title: Crisis Team Cause a Crisis!!
body: Had a mental health nurse call me back on 13/09/2022 at aprox 16:50 (my mobile ending 706) because I was having a mental health crisis and feeling suicidal! The nurse was awful, uncaring and very patronizing with me. It felt as if she wanted an argument with me and all I wanted was help with my issue. It was very lucky that my sister rang me not long after otherwise god knows what would of happened? Someone seriously needs to be looking into this service because some of the people working in the service are a disgrace to their profession!

readBy.name: Cumbria, Northumberland, Tyne and Wear NHS Foundation Trust

title: The physiotherapy staff are fantastic
body:
Had a long wait to originally be seen, but so impressed by the physiotherapists knowledge advice and help.
Excellent staff that have made a huge difference to the amount of pain that I was in.  I was lucky enough to manage a cancellation when I was really bad and the difference that made I'm so greatful for.

readBy.name: East Lancashire Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Wonderful service
body:
On Tuesday 8th September I had my annual c.o.p.d.. review at the Own Road surgery. The Nurse was extremely pleasant, thorough and efficient.  She called me with the results two days later. 
A great service.

title: GP Appointments
body: I have noticed that when we are seeing the Doctor, and they make another appointment in their system, we do not receive any slip to confirm our appointment date and times, but are expected to remember the date and time.  It would be helpful if we can receive a printed slip of next appointment so we don't forget.  Can I also recommend that with the online appointment booking service that as well as booking appointments, we can also see what future appointments are already booked with us and with whom.  Both suggestions will be helpful for the patient and also for Brocklebank to reduce the number of missed appointments.

title: Good practice
body: People complain about not being able to get an appointment to see a Dr or Nurse, I have had no problem at all I actually find it quicker than before the pandemic. Great Drs and Nurses at this practice.

title: Always helpful
body: I’ve been visiting this practice for over a year now and have always been treated with respect and care. All the doctors and nurses have been attentive and patient with their care. I feel very fortunate to have access to this practice.

title: Great practice
body: I registered around 2 years ago when I started university and I've have received a lot of help from the doctors and nurses here. When I had low mood they gave me an online therapy platform, when I had anemia I got an iron infusion and they facilitated a referral for ADHD testing. When using econsult they will usually get back to you the same day. All the medical staff and receptionists are incredibly kind and friendly. I keep trying to get my friends at uni to register as I have received a really good quality of care.

title: Excellent Practice
body: Able to be seen in person, friendly staff and great care. I was referred promptly and my faith in GPs surgeries have been restored when post COVID I had become anxious to access primary care services

author: Jon22
title: Hernia repair
body: I was a patient here for a hernia repair operation and have nothing but praise for the staff. The doctors,  nurses and Hcas were kind, professional and friendly as we're the ancillary staff. Ward was clean and comfortable, food was excellent ( everyone loves NHS toast! ). Overall my experience was very positive and I was almost sorry to leave. My thanks and appreciation to all of the staff that cared for me during my stay.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Can’t get appointment
body:
Used
To be a good doctors now they are
Awful. Can never get an appointment just called
After being on hold 20 mins to tell me
Full only 9am! Furious

readBy.name: Healthwatch Sheffield

title: Best Practice in the Borough
body: All staffs are very helpful, I have been with practice for a decade and never had any issues at all, always getting appointments , treatments and referrals when I needed, I would  definitely recommend to family friends and the others.  Thank you Riversley Road GP.

title: Great practice with brilliant advise and care
body:
Very caring practice and doctors, my son is receiving great care for his skin condition and with the help of doctors we have now been referred to dermatology which a huge step for his recovery.
The doctors show so much compassion and are trying everything they can to help my son get sorted.

title: Efficient surgery
body: I visited the surgery on 31st August and was given an appointment the same day and the care and attention I received at my appointment was excellent and the surgery arranged for scans and X-rays which were arranged within a week without me having to make the arrangements myself.

readBy.name: Highbridge Medical Centre

title: Really responsive and kind staff
body:
I joined the practice about 18 months ago and have to say that my experience has been really positive. The online request platform is easy to use, the practice is super responsive, and their staff have always been helpful and kind. 

I'd read some negative reviews, but can confidently say that for both me and my daughter, the surgery has been prompt in dealing with our medical requests/concerns. My daughter was rushed in the same day to have a lump checked; the doctor in question was reassuring and thorough. I've recently had blood tests to investigate menopause - I am 37 and every doctor/nurse I have dealt with throughout this process has been kind, helpful, and informative.

The reception staff too, who must be really up against it at times, have always been friendly and helpful. I think it's really easy to leave a negative review after a less than great experience, but genuinely feel that the staff here are a credit to the practice, so thank you!

readBy.name: Ulster University, MBBS (Medicine) 2021

title: Practice changes
body:
Went into the surgery after bank holiday weekend and was greeted by reception who checked me in, sat and waited for appointment. While waiting was acknowledged by a young lady walking through who said hi  ( first time this has happened )
spoke to the nurse at my appointment who advised was the new manager. The Surgery feels warmth and pleasant and has not been like this for years. What ever the surgery are doing it makes me smile to see new faces. I hope i get a hello again when they walk by.

title: Good practice
body: Took my husband today re concerns about health. GP gave him a thorough examination and was extremely patient. Recommended treatment . Highly recommend. We always have had first class treatment at this surgery in the 50 years he's been attending

title: No appointments available
body: I spend on average 30-40mins on the phone trying to get an appointment. There are none left, I can't even get a push doctor appointment as they have run out or this an issue. Maybe try again on Monday is the reply. If I ever try to rebook, they say you can only book a couple of weeks ahead and there are no appointments. For a full time worker it is near on impossible to get an appointment at this surgery or online - it's totally broken. Receptionist is struggling to keep up and it's over subscribed with patients and massively short staffed. Not current able to function as a GP surgery

title: Now back to being a great practice
body: I know during covid it was difficult to have many face to face appointments but for the older generation a reassurance from the doctor means a lot and taking a picture not always that easy. So very pleased to now be able to see my doctor face to face.

title: Responsive Practice
body:
When I have had to contact my GP, everyone from Receptionist to Doctor have been professional, polite, and focused on delivering care in a timely manner. I have been so impressed with how the Practice have looked after me.
Can't recommend highly enough.

title: Good luck getting through
body:
Trying to make an appointment at Chatfield Health Centre is near impossible. In fact you would have more luck winning the lottery...
Spent over 2 and half hours on the phone on hold just trying to get through to reception. Absolutely dismal service.

title: Shocking
body: Script says need bloods doing. Reception can't find anything relating. Appointments ring 0830 explained I can't because in work.and we aren't aloud phones in work. Told nothing they can do as Drs say it has to be done this way. So because I work I get penalised by not having access to appointments. Shocking practice although receptionist have improved a bit. Since the older ones have left.

title: Always excellent…
body:
I thank the Senior partner and his staff for the excellent care I received during my time as a patient over the last five years.
I found the GP’s, nursing staff, dispensary, to receptionists all very professional, helpful, a pleasant experience all round.
From initial consultation to diagnosis,then prognosis, to advice about medication.The GP would actually sit and listen, was interested in me as an individual,I was made to feel important as their patient with my niggle, problem or concern, never hurried, always sympathetic and understanding.
When someone called me at home on the phone it was if a friend was calling.
A real pleasure to have been a patient here, sadly had to register elsewhere which I thought long and hard about and definitely did not wish to do  so.

I would recommend this practice to anyone.
Who knows, one day,if permitted, I may re register if I move back that way!

title: Differing consultation leading to confusion of…
body:
Following a lengthy, painful wait in the emergency department, for the treatment of a suspected kidney stone, I was transferred to e1 ward, 12 hours later after a successful ct scan, and following a diagnosis. The Doctor on shift recommended a procedure to be carried out the following day after a night stay on the ward. The decision to carry out the procedure was reached due to the explanation of an upcoming holiday and flight, and that a flight was out of the question due to the status of the lodged kidney stone.
After fasting, and waiting for the start of the procedure, during Doctors rounds in the morning, it was immediately suggested the procedure was cancelled as unnecessary. Due to the u turn in the surgery procedure, this led to holiday plans being cancelled as was now unsure of the safety of flying with this condition. Basically, the consultants could not agree on a way forward leading to confusion within myself, the patient, and ultimately the cancellation of personal plans.

title: Outstanding care and incredible staff
body: My husband attended on 5th September for a review of a problem he has had for almost 2 years. His consultant was brilliant and had him in for surgery 4 days later. Extremely Fanta service and a massive thank you to Howell. He's an absolute credit to your trust and is incredible with patients and a lovely man.

readBy.name: South Tyneside and Sunderland NHS Foundation Trust

title: Awful experience
body: I was booked into the gp hub by a 111 operator after having been in a lot of pain. I turned up to be shouted at by the person who saw me. She was very cross 111 had sent me there, but when I asked her where I should go instead I was told she didn’t know and I would have to Google it. Feeling so unwell this was an incredibly upsetting and honestly degrading experience.

title: Fantastic Minor Surgery Service
body:
I attended Minor Surgery Service on the 06/09/2022 to have a mole removed on my chest. The 2 ladies where amazing - I was a little  nervous when I entered however, they calmed me right down and made me feel at ease. They where so lovely and distracting that before I knew it, she was finished! I was that shocked I said "Really? that quick?"
These 2 lovely ladies are such a credit to the surgery - amazing staff and I even left with a little choccy!
Thank you ladies - you're fabulous!

title: Lovely friendly staff
body: Staff are always so happy to see you and really enjoy what they do. They're very thorough in making sure you're getting the right treatment you need.

title: Worst receptionist ever
body: Receptionists are always rude, helpful, disorganised and incompetent. I had 2 lots of prescriptions lost, was then told one of the prescriptions was at the chemist, went to the chemist and it wasn't there. Went back to the doctor's who told me to get the chemist to phone them as they would no longer issue any more prescriptions, they didn't even try looking for the other one and that was it she just glared at me until I moved away. The chemist looked at me as if I was crazy but finally did call the doctors and managed after half an hour to sort the problem out. I finally got my prescription, if it wasn't for the chemist I'd still be pulling my hair out after 2 weeks of trying to get hold of my original prescription. The chemist informed me that the one and only prescription sent were sent today just after I went back down to the doctors to complain that I couldn't get my prescription so they hadn't sent it in the 1st place. As a disabled widow on pensions who has to rely on her car this has cost me a fortune in petrol, time, energy and pain. Where is the doctor could have given me a written prescription as I had a face-to-face doctors appointment anyway today on the 5th of sept. But as they had already lost my written prescription that someone had printed off for me on Friday but I physically and financially could not afford to go back to the doctor's yet again to pick it up, it had to wait until Monday when I was going to the doctor's anyway so when I went to the reception desk they said that they couldn't find it so that was the 3rd prescription that they had actually lost. This has never happened to this degree but it does actually happen on almost a buy monthly basis, that they will either lose prescriptions, forget to issue prescriptions and they won't let me go back to a paperbase prescription that I can keep an eye on. They're saying that they just don't do that anymore but they definitely should cause it worked fine for me before.

title: Awful practice
body: First at all you have to call to get an appointment you have to give the reason for the appointment that person on the phone says  has to talk with the doctor to give you an appointment after that you have to wait next day if you miss the call for some reason you have to start all the process again it is impossible to get an appointment online, ridiculous. I went to this Gp with stomach problems I did blood test and stool test the doctor said he is not sure but he thinks I have IBS even if I don't have the symptoms he thinks I have IBS he prescribed me tablets that I can get over the counter if I go to the doctor is because nothing over the counter worked, if a doctor doesn't know for sure what the patient has he needs to send this patient to see the specialist otherwise doctors are putting in jeopardy life of the patient if I were a doctor I would never risk life of a person I tried to understand why a doctor would take that risk and my answer is simple :they don't care.

title: Disappointing consultation
body: I attended my regular 6 monthly appointment to rheumatology. I have always seen the same rheumatologist and cannot praise her enough for being caring and thorough. Today I saw a registrar and was not impressed at the end of the consultation. I told her that I had a flare up for the first time in a long time and my DAS score would not be as good as on previous occasions. I did say the joints seem to be ok now but in the past I have been given thorough joint examination despite my comments. Her examination of my joints was cursory and I did not even have to get onto the couch for her to examine my knee joints. I did not ask for the DAS score as I cannot imagine she could have determined any numbers. I was extremely disappointed by the experience.

readBy.name: Medway NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great doctors
body: They definitely need to sort the appointment problem also e consult should be on a lot longer than it is. I have been with this doctors a long time 33 years to be precise I only like to see a select few of doctors as it makes me more comfortable as this hasn’t been an issue. Doctors are great 😊 they know me and we have a great rapport I feel comfortable with them. I suffer with PTSD and the doctors are so helpful when I am in distress. Thank you

title: Unhelpful
body:
Receptionists are quite short and rude. And a doctor call back is a joke. I have been given a call back from a doctor (15min talk over the phone) after what I have been told that they need to see me but the doctor I was speaking to is going home so I will get another call back. I have been seen by paramedic with severe allergy reaction (email was sent to the gp) and my conditions were getting worse but in the emial it did not include a word urgent therefore as I have been told by the receptionist if I feel is that bad just go to a&e and don’t bother calling them. I will definitely change to a different GP. 
Plus noticed few times my kids conditions and doctor call backs were not noted on a system.

author: Niamhh1
title: more meal options
body: The food is not great at all, I had problems with the food in Craigavon and it’s clear to see that there isn’t much difference here in lurgan. I don’t think there is enough variety and the standard of food just is not great. I’m pretty sure all hospital food is just the same, but I would like to see some more options that are a bit more appealing.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Wonderful nurse and receptionist.
body: Having traveled to this surgery (not my local one), I would continue to make the extra miles to visit the wonderful staff at this surgery. My appointment was with the nurse for a blood test. The nurse was amazing, kind, professional and such a warm personality. She is a absolute credit to the surgery. By the time I left I felt I had made a strong and trustworthy relationship with her. If I was feeling nervous then I know she would be the one to support me. Also want to recognise the lovely lady in reception, also very welcoming.  To sum up my experience is a wonderful and caring team and going the extra mile. The nurse in question deserves every bit of luck that life can offer.

title: Unfortunately common receptionist issue
body:
I understand that you have trained receptionist to ask briefly about issues but  today's in counter implied I could not speak to doctor without telling her reason of my making appointment, 

This could be improved with scripted like : (if possible could I ask for brief description on why your making call to ensure you get the best care today thank you) less confrontational from the start this way

She told me with annoyance tone that she just gave away last appointment as if I could wait till tomorrow for appointment. I replied if I can make appointment now for tomorrow I'm happy to do so, she quickly shot me down saying she won't do that as against there policy's, I mentioned that your policy doesn't effect my 7 month year old son health..

And I was told numerous times I'm being rude in making that connection no raised voice from me or swearing so simply not wanting to wait to make appointment next day is rude in there eyes 

I have this audio recorded if anyone would like to here this

But does seems like it a on going issue that see no end in site due to reviews on here or on google

title: Excellent practice
body: I requested a telephone consultation with my GP to discuss the results of some recent investigations. The call was on time and the doctor discussed the results with me and listened to my concerns carefully. We were able to share management options and agreed when the tests needed to be repeated and how I could obtain the necessary forms. The doctor was very professional and put me at my ease quickly. I would highly recommend this practice.

title: lovely
body: Reception staff are very friendly and helpful, easy to make appointments compared to other surgeries, I like that it is a small practice, family friendly, Dr H is a wonderful Gp I would not go anywhere else.

title: Disgusting behaviours and attitudes
body:
While there has been some good medical care and pleasant communication from mature receptionists there are some extremely bad staff here. They are young, rude, lack capacity to show basic manners and an embarrassment to the NHS. One receptionist was sitting picking at a cold sore when I went In the other day.
The patient services manager and team leader do not respond to anything professionally and if you email in you don’t get an response. It’s sad that the nhs has been allowed to sell of its services to Affinity Care. Th partners of this company will be enjoying their profits while patients suffer.

title: Very good experience
body:
It was a very good experience. The people I saw were easy to talk to, and made me feel that I mattered. There was no feeling of having to rush.
I was seen at the appointed time, and not kept waiting.

title: Amazing staff
body: Reception team are very kind and provide great customer service. Clinical team also very nice and make your experience very comfortable.

title: Blood test results lost
body: I visited the hospital in May to do my 2 blood test. I received one of the results in 2 weeks time and waiting a month for the results of the other test to come through, unfortunately no results came for that one but just the hospital saying that there is an error with my test and I need to repeat it. I went again to repeat my test on 7th of July. I waited a month and a half and I contacted my GP regarding the results of the repeated test. There was no results and my GP practice contacted the hospital to ask the hospital what happened with my results. The hospital only replied that they don’t have any results for me!! Now I have to go again and that’s very frustrating. I am absolutely disappointed of the Hospital reply because they even didn’t put any effort to find my results and find who did the mistake and who lost the samples!! I would suggest any one that need to do blood test not to visit Chase Farm Hospital due to not competant and unorganized staff!!

readBy.name: Royal Free London NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very helpful
body: I have read poor reviews of this practice. However I have to report that I have had face to face appointments, which were deemed necessary, and friendly, helpful and efficient dealings with the reception staff. I find emailing the practice a useful way of communicating.

title: Quick and easy check up
body: Limes staff made it very easy to book my daughter in for her 16 week jabs. We were seen on time and it was all done swiftly.

title: Great practice
body: I’ve never had an issue with this surgery I’ve had problems elsewhere. But they’ve always gone above and beyond for me. Whether that referral  or needing support within the practice. E-Consult always fast response and they do their best to provide me with practical advice and treatment. I would recommend this practice.

title: Thorough pharmacist
body: A helpful pharmacist who followed up with a call to check on anticipated changes to my medications. A polite & courteous gentleman.

title: Appalling practice
body: Response to completed online request form was a text to say case had been reviewed by duty team and could I forward email from hospital to the link provided.  There was no linkso a 40 min wait on phone to be told it would be sent immediatly, which it was - but the link contained an error so was no use. 20 mins on phone to report failure and obtain correct email address. Email re-sent and 24 hrs later with no response phoned again (20 mins on hold in queue) to be told person was at lunch and would call me back. Then received a text to advise my second email had not been received as original email link had been incorrect and could I resent email to the second address I used yesterday. The mos inefficient administrative system I have ever encountered - and I am a Chartered Secretary!

author: Mck83
title: Home visit ECG and advice
body:
Had a really nice visit from Fiona who not only did my ECG and weight etc she asked about any other overall health problems I may have.  
Fiona gave advice on what I could do to resolve them as I went through the general problems I have.  
She was able to talk to me in a way I could understand was very respectful and polite and helped made me feel good we need more people like this

readBy.name: Nottinghamshire Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent Practise
body:
I used the doctrine option on the Oundle Lakeside Practise website and I got an appointment the very next day, putting my mind at rest.
The Dr was fantastic, reception staff friendly and very efficiant.
The practise has always been excellent to be fair and provide an excellent service. Thank you very much!

author: Dotty Ava
title: Post Menopausal Bleed Clinic - Ultrasound
body: Post Menopausal Bleed Clinic - I was so impressed by my whole experience today. I had an ultrasound and a hysteroscopy. There was plenty of inexpensive parking and no waiting time at all for my appointment. The waiting areas were quiet and everyone wore masks so I felt very safe. All the practitioners and receptionists were excellent! They explained everything clearly and were happy to answer all of my many questions. They were warm and friendly and made me feel really at ease. They really were a lovely team. Thank you so much everyone for all your help and support today.

readBy.name: United Lincolnshire Hospitals NHS Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

title: Great Experience
body: When I was struggling to find medical advice upon coming home from university for the holidays, Harvey Group Practice stepped up and immediately offered their services and signed me up as a temporary patient quickly and efficiently. The doctor I spoke to was patient, kind and helpful, and I'm very grateful for the care provided. I would highly recommend Harvey Group Practice - they helped me immensely in my time of need. I have no complaints.

readBy.name: Harvey Group Practice

title: Excellent surgery
body:
This practice has been fantastic from the very start.
The reception team have been wonderful and polite and answered all my questions. The wait time has been very quick and the doctors and nurses have made me feel at ease.  While out in the waiting room the doctors and nurses greeted each time even if I didn't have appointment with them and they were only passing. 
I can only praise this practice.  I would highly recommend this practice to people.
Thank you for all you have done for me  
keep up the great work through this tough time.

readBy.name: NHS Leeds ICB

title: Fantastic Practice and Team
body:
Over the last year I have needed to use the practice a few times. I have found their response to online consultations to be quick and thorough. When calling the receptionists for administrative help they have always been friendly and efficient and the practice nurse was fantastic during my wound care. 
The GP’s I think are good that they consider both monitoring current treatment and ensuring preventative health options are taken. My prescriptions are always on time with minimal effort on my side. Overall I think you should be proud of the service you provide. Thank you!!

title: Thanks
body:
I would like to say a big thanks to all the doctors nurses and housekeeping for all your kindness, given to me.
Everyone works so hard.

Love to you all
Jill Holder 
Xx

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust (2)

title: Great Practice
body: Fabulous caring staff who go the extra mile to make one feel valued. Good listeners and always oblige in meeting appointment needs - receptionists  nurses and GPs Appreciate them all. So fortunate to have this service.

author: corridorkb43
title: I appreciate and value all the visual aids and equipment
body:
I would like to thank Carmel & Brian sensory support workers, for their professional input and guidance given to me over the last months.  
I appreciate and value all the visual aids and equipment that was given to me. I have gained more confidence in myself since using them daily.  
Thank You To All The Team.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust
Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

title: Very straightforward appointment
body: Arrived early and almost instantly was able to see my GP. He was very helpful and reassuring in his advice.

title: Clinical pharmacist
body: the clinical pharmacist was extremely helpful and knowledgeable and left me feeling reassured following my consultation with her, where she gave me a full snd detailed explanation of my condition and it’s causes and recommended treatment. Thank you.

title: Biopsy
body: Appointment was on time. Very good doctor who explained the procedure.   Felt comfortable with the procedure which was painless.

author: fedupwithitall
title: Misdiagnosis and lack of communication
body:
I have autism (recently diagnosed) and other mental health issues, I am 24 years old, since I was 14 I have been going backwards and forwards to GP with bowel issues and was told I had IBS. I was eventually a couple of years ago referred to Gastroenterology at Gartnavel Royal and had an Mri and colonoscopy. I was again told slight shading in bowel but nothing to worry about.  
I got a phonecall several months ago from a dietician who asked me how my chronic disease was affecting my day to day life and I said I don't have chronic disease, they went over all my personal details and confirmed I did indeed have chronic disease.  
I spoke to my GP as my stomach was causing me to lose control of my bowels and I was having accidents. I was sent an appointment for another mri and today I recieved a letter to say that there is no evidence of chronic disease and to send a stool sample however they will continue to focus on my mental health problems.  
Gastroenterology? Mental health?  
I feel that the service I have been receiving is inapproptiate and dangerous .. I am losing faith in the NHS due to a lack of patient communication and care.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)
NHS Greater Glasgow & Clyde
Scottish Recovery Network

author: Jul53
title: I felt less alone in my struggle
body: I was very glad to have support from the Condition Management Programme staff during my 'long covid' illness.  I was treated with respect, understanding and empathy at a time when little was/is known about 'long covid'.  I felt less alone in my struggle and was offered advice on how to best manage my symptoms.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

title: No feedback after 11 months
body: Took my child for an audiology test. Was told verbally that there is a hearing loss. nothing further has happened after 11 months.

readBy.name: Royal Free London NHS Foundation Trust

title: Use caution and document everything
body:
This practice needs a CQC review to hopefully improve in attitude and learn from mistakes. Use caution, be open minded to many errors, dishonesty and mild discriminatory actions. 
On a plus side, the staff nurse in the centre is a credit to the NHS. Very welcoming, reassuring and understanding to mental health illnesses and neurodevelopmental disorders. She is brilliant and deserves to be in a much more stable and supportive practice. 

Double check notes, record everything and be honest.

title: Helpful Pharmacist
body: The pharmacist rang me today to talk through my elderly mother's medication and provided me with a clear explanation of the medicines and arranged to see him to discuss further. Very helpful - thank you.

title: lovely doctors
body: me and my family have been registered at this practice all our lives and we never want to change. they take good care of us. thank you

author: Clahm83
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: Gratitude to all of the carers who attended my husband
body:
I would like to express my gratitude to all the carers who had attended my husband, I can not speak highly enough of all carers and felt like they treated my husband as they would their own family .  
I also feel the carers where so kind and considerate to me as well as my husband, I will really miss them all coming in daily but I am grateful for the wonderful care that was given to my family in our time of need.

readBy.name: South Ayrshire Health and Social Care Partnership

title: Some receptionists are meen to help
body: We applied for a paid letter through the link sent by the GP practice. We completed the online request on the 28th July. After weeks we were told that they are not doing any letters due to backlog and the person in charge is on leave. Then we were asked to resubmit the request and we did. Then we awaited for some time and received a link for our conssent to receive invoice. We consented and replied. No response for several days after that. Yesterday , after one month of our original request, when we contacted again we were asked to resubmit the request for the letter 3rd time and received a link to submit our request and consent. We did and still waiting. The letter is urgently needed since the Job Centre stopped the payment one month ago.

title: Professional and friendly practice
body:
I am always been greeted with a smile and the doctors and staff are very good to understand my health issues and provide good feedback and advice.
Very proactive to call and check for appointment and very adjusting when I needed a time change for my b12 injections. 
I haven't had any bad experience at this surgery, so thumbs up to the wonderful staff and doctors!

title: Disappointed
body: I did a review in July 2022 I was advice to spk to the duty manager so I rang for an appt  the manager was away it was the deputy manager who answer the phone I explain my reason for calling and book an appt to see him but when I turn up for my appt no one seem to know I was coming the receptionist went to the room at the back of her then came back to me and said he will be with me then the duty manager came out and she the deputy manager is not in she took me to a room I explain my issues she told me she will look into it and get back to me she never did this was July we are in September never heard from her which did not surprise me very disappointed

readBy.name: The Lawson Practice

author: Trithy!
title: Help with anxiety and low mood
body: After an incredibly difficult year for multiple reasons (including bereavement, change of financial circumstances, and transition into adulthood) which heightened my mental health struggles I already had, over a few months I had sessions speaking over the phone with a woman from a wellbeing service. I began feeling very vulnerable and unsure about everything, but she was very caring, patient and understanding, and helped me 'where I was at'. She went at my pace, gave me time and space while always being there, and never pushed me. She helped remind me of tools I already used in my life, and gave me some new and interesting perspectives or tools to try alongside that, which I found worked, and gave me options. She also just listened to me while I talked about what bothered me. I can't think of anything that could be better about the service based on my experience. I felt genuinely listened to and supported on my journey.

readBy.name: NHS Borders

title: Phone consultation
body:
I called and spoke to a receptionist and asked for appointment regarding 2 matters, both I believe need to be checked physically by a doctor. Next available phone consultation is 3 days away so I accept. I speak to the doctor about a injury and she tells me as long as I have moment there is unlikely to be a issue. When I bought up second issue she told me she doesn’t have time to speak about that. 
Very poor service from our local gp’s. 
No wonder hospitals are bursting at the seems because because can’t get any help from the doctors leaving them no choice to go to Urgent care or a&e

title: Compassionate and responsive practice
body:
I have been dealing with The Beeches Medical Practice regularly on behalf of my elderly parents throughout the year. I have found all members of the administrative and clinical team to be incredibly professional, caring and responsive. Whether we have submitted e-consults, required a home visit/surgery consultation, or made urgent medication requests, our queries have always been dealt with  in a timely manner and by the most appropriate member of the team. 
They continue to provide an excellent service despite an overwhelming increase in demand.
